Author: sandwich6793
Content: Ahhh

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: That depends where you are assigned to. In many cases, I saw young kader being lower staffs that helped in smaller teams and programs to do the party's bigger agenda

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: And if you do have potential to become big, whether through your connections, wealth and skills, you can rose up the ranks pretty quickly

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: At least becoming the smaller head of the party's village area, then slowly reaching into town or city position could be a good start

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: You could even contribute to the regional effort of the party to gain more votes from the locals through various campaign projects

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: Or even bansos, official meetings, management, etc

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: You will be lucky if during your short period of membership, you will already be assigned to assist or become assistant for a big figure inside the party or the party leader like Surya Paloh

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: You might want to push more for your skills on the field, especially in cleaning, participating on various field events, etc

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: Most lower staffs start in this position

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: And if you have experience on it, they would count on you to do this task

Author: glassesofwater
Content: Not sure they have good cadre development

Author: darkzet
Content:
what skills do you suggest we have when we join a parpol? 
(i dont understand your sentence here)

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: Sorry to reply just now

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content:
But what I meant from my previous statement mainly talking about younger cadres working in labor-intensive or operational roles. Like I stated before, they would relied on you with field tasks if you are a young cadre or able to operate on the field:
1. Event setup & teardown, basically you are able to organize venues, setting up various ornaments for the party's decorations, etc.
2. Small-team coordination, self explainable.
3. Field communication along with its execution, basically communicate and being able to understand the instrument that are given. 
4. Technical or maintenance operation from using digital tools, setting up lights or fixing electricity for the event, etc.
5. If you are good with datas or documenting, you will be tasked with documenting or handling reports.

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: And this is still true even if you are a senior cadre or official with certain position. During my last meet with Anthony Winza Probowo like a year ago or two, even he himself admitted that he needed to help with these tasks to gain people's sympathy or simply when there are no workers or staffs there able to execute these tasks.
